titles.ar: كتاب الزِّيِّ وَ التَّجَمُّلِ وَ الْمُرُوءَةِ
titles.en: The Book of Outfits and the Beautification and the Magnanimity
Chapter 35 – The Beard and the Moustache
Chapter 35 – The Beard and the Moustache

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ الْمُثَنَّى عَنْ سَدِيرٍ الصَّيْرَفِيِّ قَالَ رَأَيْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَأْخُذُ عَارِضَيْهِ وَ يُبَطِّنُ لِحْيَتَهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hisham Bin Al Musna, from Sadeyr Al Sayrafi who said, 
‘I saw Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> pluck his<sup>asws</sup> two cheeks, and line his<sup>asws</sup> beard’.

verses.text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ صَالِحِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمَّادٍ جَمِيعاً عَنِ الْوَشَّاءِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ عَائِذٍ عَنْ أَبِي خَدِيجَةَ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ خُنَيْسٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَا زَادَ مِنَ اللِّحْيَةِ عَنِ الْقَبْضَةِ فَهُوَ فِي النَّارِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moala Bin Muhammad, and Ali Bin Muhammad, from Salih Bin Abu Hammad, altogether from Al Washa, from Ahmad Bin A’aiz, from Abu Khadeeja, from Moala Bin Khunays, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Whatever exceeds from the beard from the fist, so it is in the Fire’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ سَعْدٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فِي قَدْرِ اللِّحْيَةِ قَالَ تَقْبِضُ بِيَدِكَ عَلَى اللِّحْيَةِ وَ تَجُزُّ مَا فَضَلَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from Ali Bin Is’haq Bin Sa’ad, from one of his companions, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> regarding the extent of the beard. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Clutch your beard by your hand, and cut whatever remains’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ الزَّيَّاتِ قَالَ رَأَيْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَدْ خَفَّفَ لِحْيَتَهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from Usman Bin Isa, from Abdullah Bin Muskan, from Al Hassan Al Zayyat who said, 
‘I saw Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having lightened his<sup>asws</sup> beard’.

verses.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّضْرِ بْنِ سُوَيْدٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ الْخَزَّازِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ رَأَيْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( صلوات الله عليه ) وَ الْحَجَّامُ يَأْخُذُ مِنْ لِحْيَتِهِ فَقَالَ دَوِّرْهَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
From him, from his father, from Al Nazar Bin Suweyd, from one of his companions, from Abu Ayoub Al Khazzaz, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said, 
‘I saw Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> and the barber was plucking from his<sup>asws</sup> beard, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Curve it’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) إِنَّ مِنَ السُّنَّةِ أَنْ تَأْخُذَ مِنَ الشَّارِبِ حَتَّى يَبْلُغَ الْإِطَارَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Al Sakuny, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘It is from the Sunnah that you pluck from the moustache until it reaches the verge’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنِ الْعَمْرَكِيِّ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَخِيهِ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ قَصِّ الشَّارِبِ أَ مِنَ السُّنَّةِ قَالَ نَعَمْ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Al Amraky Bin Ali, 
(It has been narrated) from Ali son of Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, from his brother<sup>asws</sup> Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about trimming the moustache, is it from the Sunnah?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ ابْنِ فَضَّالٍ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ ذَكَرْنَا الْأَخْذَ مِنَ الشَّارِبِ فَقَالَ نُشْرَةٌ وَ هُوَ مِنَ السُّنَّةِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ibn Fazzal, from the one who mentioned it, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘We mentioned the plucking from the moustache, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It is a good display, and it is from the Sunnah’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَسْبَاطٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ أَنَّهُ رَأَى أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَحْفَى شَارِبَهُ حَتَّى أَلْصَقَهُ بِالْعَسِيبِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from one of our companions, from Ali Bin Asbaat, 
(It has been narrated) from Abdullah Bin Usman that he saw Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> press his<sup>asws</sup> moustache until it was pasted like a palm branch’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَمَّنْ أَخْبَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَا زَادَ عَلَى الْقَبْضَةِ فَفِي النَّارِ يَعْنِي اللِّحْيَةَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muhammad Bin Abu Hamza, from the one who informed him, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Whatever increases upon the fist, so it is in the Fire’ – meaning the beard’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ النَّوْفَلِيِّ عَنِ السَّكُونِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) لَا يُطَوِّلَنَّ أَحَدُكُمْ شَارِبَهُ فَإِنَّ الشَّيْطَانَ يَتَّخِذُهُ مَخْبَأً يَسْتَتِرُ بِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Al Nowfaly, from Al Sakuny, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Not one of you should lengthen his moustache, for the Satan<sup>la</sup> takes it as a hideout to hide by’.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنِ الدِّهْقَانِ عَنْ دُرُسْتَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَرَّ بِالنَّبِيِّ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) رَجُلٌ طَوِيلُ اللِّحْيَةِ فَقَالَ مَا كَانَ عَلَى هَذَا لَوْ هَيَّأَ مِنْ لِحْيَتِهِ فَبَلَغَ ذَلِكَ الرَّجُلَ فَهَيَّأَ لِحْيَتَهُ بَيْنَ اللِّحْيَتَيْنِ ثُمَّ دَخَلَ عَلَى النَّبِيِّ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) فَلَمَّا رَآهُ قَالَ هَكَذَا فَافْعَلُوا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from one of his companions, from Al Dahqan, from Dorost, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There passed by the Prophet<sup>saww</sup> a man with a long beard. So he<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Had he not been upon this. If only he had adjusted his beard’. So that reached the man, so he adjusted his beard to be between the two beards (medium length), then he went over to the Prophet<sup>saww</sup>. So when he<sup>saww</sup> saw him, he<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Like this, so keep doing it’.
